pfsystems.documentation: Description of the active poloidal coils, passive conductors, currents flowing in those and mutual electromagnetic effects of the device; Time-dependent CPO

coilcurrent.documentation: Circuit feed current in the coil , defined positive if it flows from point 1 to point 2 of the component in the pfcircuit description [A]; Time-dependent; Vector (ncoils)

value.reminder: Enter in the structure below how to retrieve this variable from the experimental database. Replicate this element if more than one signal needs to be read in the local database

name.documentation: Name of the signal in the local database

value.name: MAY|IV1o

download.documentation: Description of the method for calculating the signal. Fill the relevant elements below.
Name of the download method, as listed in the top element mapping_info/download_method/name. In case of a constant value, put 'fixed' here and fill the 'fixed-value' element below.

fixed_value.documentation: Fixed value of the signal in case 'download' = 'fixed'. NB : this value will be repeated in all time slices of the ITM signal, except if 'interpolation' = 0. Optional.

fixed_repeat.documentation: Repeat factor for the fixed value given above; this tag contains the same number of values than fixed_value. Optional.

coefa.documentation: After download, the signal can be transformed as coefa * signal + coefb. Optional.

coefb.documentation: After download, the signal can be transformed as coefa * signal + coefb. Optional.

interpolation.documentation: Interpolation method : 2 for previous sample, 3 for linear interpolation (as in the UAL), 0 if no interpolation required (also useful for a string or signal that does not depend on time in ITM format).

dimension.documentation: Dimension of the signal : 1 for vector, 2 for matrix, ... s for string, 0 if non-time dependent in the local DB (may need to be repeated at each time slice in ITM format, though)

size.documentation: Size of the local DB signal (number of columns in the data matrix) mandatory only for 2D signals

time_dim.documentation: Specifies which of the above dimension represents time.

value.name: %TDI%_bubu=MAKE_SIGNAL(augsignal(%SHOT%,"MAY","dIOH2s")+augsignal(%SHOT%,"MAY","dIOH2u"),augsignal(%SHOT%,"MAY","IOH"),dim_of(augsignal(%SHOT%,"MAY","IOH"))); _sig=_bubu

coefb.documentation: After download, the signal can be transformed as coefa * signal + coefb. Optional.

interpolation.documentation: Interpolation method : 2 for previous sample, 3 for linear interpolation (as in the UAL), 0 if no interpolation required (also useful for a string or signal that does not depend on time in ITM format).

dimension.documentation: Dimension of the local DB signal : 1 for vector, 2 for matrix, ... s for string, 0 if non-time dependent in the local DB (may need to be repeated at each time slice in ITM format, though)

size.documentation: Size of the local DB signal (number of columns in the data matrix) mandatory only for 2D signals

time_dim.documentation: Specifies which of the above dimension represents time (in the local DB).

toroidal.documentation: Toroidal current induced in passive structures [A]. Vector (nelements); Time-dependent

value.reminder: Enter in the structure below how to retrieve this variable from the experimental database. Replicate this element if more than one signal needs to be read in the local database

fixed_repeat.documentation: Repeat factor for the fixed value given above; this tag contains the same number of values than fixed_value. Optional.

time_base.documentation: Declaration of the multiple time bases in the experimental database, used for calculating the common (CPO) one

sampling_rate.documentation: String 'min' or 'max' : Use the highest sampling rate (min) or the lowest sampling rate (max) of all experimental time bases to define the common time base

time.documentation: List of the experimental time bases used for this CPO (replicate this element if more than one must be used)

name.documentation: Name of the time base in the experimental database

time.name: MAY|IV1o

download.documentation: Name of the download method, as listed in the top element mapping_info/download_method/name

pfsystems.documentation: Description of the active poloidal coils, passive conductors, currents flowing in those and mutual electromagnetic effects of the device; Time-dependent CPO

datainfo.documentation: Generic information on a data item

dataprovider.documentation: Name of the actual data provider (the person who filled the data)

putdate.documentation: Date at which the data has been put in the DB

source.documentation: Exact reference of the data source (e.g. original reference in the native machine data base)

datainfo.comment: The PSL appear both as pfcoils and pfpassive (finer discretization in pfpassive - each of the 6 elements in each PSL is divided in 4 smaller elements - it has to do with the moments used in the expansion of the currents inside but to dominant order for equilibrium reconstructions we can assume a uniform current inside the PSL). The order of the pfcoils has changed since it mimics the ordering used in CLISTE

cocos.documentation: COordinates COnventionS followed by this CPO

id.documentation: CPO id for checking its provenance in the workflow

name.documentation: Name of coil. Array of strings (ncoils)

id.documentation: ID of coil. Array of strings (ncoils)

emax.documentation: Maximum Energy to be dissipated in coils [J]; Vector (ncoils)

pol_flux_cs.documentation: Maximum poloidal flux available in the Central Solenoid for a plasma pulse [Wb].

nelement.documentation: Number of elements used to describe a coil; Vector (ncoils)

name.documentation: Name of this element. Should be a matrix of strings (ncoils,max_nelements), but not supported by the UAL yet.

id.documentation: ID of this element. Should be a matrix of strings (ncoils,max_nelements), but not supported by the UAL yet.

turnsign.documentation: Sign of turn and fraction of a turn for calculating magnetic field of the Element; Matrix (ncoils,max_nelements)

area.documentation: Surface area of this element [m^2]; Matrix (ncoils,max_nelements)

pfgeometry.documentation: Shape of a PF Coil Element

type.documentation: Type used to describe a coil shape (0 for 'rzcoordinates' or 1 for 'rzdrdz'); Matrix of integers (ncoils,max_nelements)

npoints.documentation: Number of points describing an element (irregular outline rzcoordinates); Matrix (ncoils,max_nelements)

rzdrdz.documentation: 4-vector defining Centre R,Z and full extents dR, dZ [m]; 3D Array (ncoils,max_nelements,4)

name.documentation: Name of coil. Array of strings (nelements)

area.documentation: Surface area of this passive element [m^2]; Vector (nelements)

type.documentation: Type used to describe the shape (0 for 'rzcoordinates' or 1 for 'rzdrdz'); Vector of integers (nelements)

npoints.documentation: Number of points describing an element (irregular outline rzcoordinates); Vector of integers (nelements)

rzdrdz.documentation: 4-vector defining Centre R,Z and full extents dR, dZ [m]; Matrix (nelements,4)

pfcircuits.documentation: Circuits, connected to multiple coils and to multiple supplies, defining the current and voltage relationships in the system

name.documentation: Name of circuit, array of strings (ncircuits)

pfcircuits.name: Put value here

id.documentation: ID of circuit, array of strings (ncircuits)

type.documentation: Type of circuit, array of strings (ncircuits)

nnodes.documentation: Number of nodes used to describe a circuit. Vector (ncircuits)

connections.documentation: Description of the supplies and coils connections (nodes) across each circuit. Array 3D (ncircuits,max_nnodes,2*ncomponents), describing for each node which component are connected to it (1 if connected, 0 otherwise). There are 2 sides at each component, thus 2*ncomponents as the size of the third dimension, listing first all supplies, then all coils (in the same order as listed in PFSUPPLIES and PFCOILS). An example can be found in the data structure documentation PFconnections.pdf

name.documentation: Name of the supply; Array of strings (nsupplies)

id.documentation: ID of the supply; Array of strings (nsupplies)

type.documentation: Type of supply; Array of strings (nsupplies)

delay.documentation: Pure delay in the supply [s]; Vector (nsupplies)

num.documentation: Coefficients of the numerator, in increasing order : a0 + a1*s + ... + an*s^n; Matrix (nsupplies,n)

den.documentation: Coefficients of the denominator, in increasing order : b0 + b1*s + ... + bm*s^m; Matrix (nsupplies,m)

emax.documentation: Maximum Energy to be dissipated in supply [J]; Vector (nsupplies)
